Name: Faience overseer shabti
Description: An overseer shabti in a blue glazed faience, with details in black. The left arm is straight down at the side, the right grasps a whip. The Overseer is dressed in everday garments, sleeves are evident and it wears a short double wig with a long, knotted headband at the back. On the projecting front panel of the kilt is a single column of faded text. The legs are short giving the figure a stocky appearance, the back is flat.
